column5: This past weekend I fished a cottage in the Muskoka Area.  The bass were on fire to say the least.  In the late morning I hit a fish off of an island with an x-rap.  I then had two more short-strike on my spinnerbait.  Knowing the fish were in the area, I slowed down.  I nailed one a stick worm, and three more slow trolling with the x-rap.  I was fishing alone at this point, so excuse the quality of the pictures.        This one was the fattest of the bunch...maybe in the 3 lb range:    I also tagged a couple of the dock with the x-rap.  One even coffed up a plastic worm:      After some lunch and some rest, I ventured back out around 7:00.  Armed with a skitter-pop, I hit fish everywhere I turned.  Throughout the night I caught around 20 fish, and must have missed or lost at least 10 more.  Of those fish, only one was caught on something besides the popper - a worm - and most of the fish were over 1lb.  The only worm fish:        Great largie:    Nice release shot:      This smallie was pretty dark:      Most of the fish, without exception, would hit the popper after two pops.  I would cast as close to shore as possible, two pops, and a pause.  That would usually enough to do it.     I hope you enjoyed.
nice going looks like a lot of bass there
nice report
nice!
nice! were you using perch pattern x-rap?
Pink was the colour of the day...but that was also the only colour I threw.
beauty fish, and looks like light tackle. I bet they gave a good run or two before they hit the boat
Not too light...spinning rods were medium action, and rigged with 8 lb test.  But yeah, some of the smallies made some incredible jumps.
nice fish
Awesome dude    Loved to bronze shots Leechman
Nice fish, sounds like a great time!!  Thanx for sharing
Great report! Gotta love Muskoka. Its deep waters can be intimidating but when you find the fish, hold on to your rod!
great report!!!  i was on lake muskoka as well for a couple days.  fun times for sure!  nobody fishes that lake!!!  all to busy showing off there mega bucks i suppose?  cheers!
Some nice fish there! Looks like the sun got your face those days.
Some nice Bass there!
nice fish...
Love the fish, and the progression of the sunburn is hilarious too
nice.  looks like fun!
were those caught recently? says 2006
They definitly were not caught on January first. Wrong date on camera for sure.
sweet fish
Yeah, caught just a few days before the report...for some reason the camera (my mom's) was set to have a date stamp and, obviously, the date was set incorrectly.  No ice* fishing for me lol.
looks like you had a great time... thanks for the pics and report
Very healthy looking bass.
